text: <@U04BD6KB1> I put my images in the `vendor` directory but they don't turn up in the app's `dist` output
let me check something ...

ok so I need to correct myself what I've done in the past is put assets that I want broccoli to include in its pipeline in `vendor/[addon-name]/` directory (typically css files) or instead you should be able to put images into `/public/images/` ('images' isn't strictly needed but I always use it).
<https://github.com/stefanpenner/ember-improved-cp>

attachments.title: stefanpenner/ember-improved-cp
attachments.text: Contribute to ember-improved-cp development by creating an account on GitHub.

text: interesting addon
>In most cases, we likely actually want our computed properties to be readOnly. This was discussed for ember 2.0.0, but due to the potential upgrade pain it was decided against.
<@U043951H9> are there performance benefits or just the immutability guarantee?
btw, looking at Ember's `mut` helper I notice it has a signure of:
> `mut(morph, env, scope, originalParams, hash, template, inverse)`
i'm just wondering why this signature is different from the public signature for _helpers_
I've just updated to ember-cli 2.9-beta and I got rid of ember-browserify
this RFC is ace: <https://github.com/ember-cli/rfcs/pull/55>

text: <@U040MK408> very interesting. I'm currently working on something which has browserify/AMD deps. Looking at this though I'm not entirely sure what steps are needed to get this working? Is it just a matter of using the latest `loader.js` and then doing an `npm install`?
<@U04BD6KB1>: I'm not sure on the performance though he does have a small paragraph about mid way down the repo. I'm on the bus, otherwise I'd post it.
<@U04BD6KB1> the library has to be in bower_components or in vendor
Then install ember-cli beta
And import it with that new syntax
And then you can import it as any other
i don't see the "new import syntax" can you point that to me?
`app.import('/path/to/module.js');`
did you need the `using: [ ...]` parameter?
yes
that
it's in the RFC
you have to give a name to the anonymous AMD library
to be able to import it
